result.execSummary:
The defendant Ruben V Garcia was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Intentional Homicide, a class A felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.01(1)(a).
  • 1st-Degree Intentional Homicide, a class A felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.01(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay restitution in the following amounts:  $4,435.08 to be paid to Susan G.  This amount is to be paid first; $3,970.40 to be paid to Crime Victim Compensation Program; and $1,500.00 to be paid to Milwaukee County Health and Human Services.

Provide DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge on both counts.
Pay all costs, fees, surcharges on each count as well  as restitution. All to be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds/earnings.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count two. Credit for 425 days.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms; also advised that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in  any election until his civil rights are restored.

Conditions of  Extended Supervision:  
No contact with any of the following people:  Alexi D., Patrick D. and Paula D.; Christopher H.; Jolene S. and Richard D.;  Susan G.; Sherry Z.

Concurrent with: Concurrent with count one.  Credit for 425 days.
---Defendant is eligible for release to Extended Supervision after serving 60 years.

Per order dated December 22, 2020, Appeal No. 2017AP1969-CRNM, IT IS ORDERED that the judgment is summarily affirmed.  See WIS. STAT. RULE 809.21.  IT IS FURHTER ORDERED that Attorney Angela Conrad Kachelski is relieved of further representation of Garcia in this matter.  See WIS. STAT. RULE 809.32(3).  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this summary disposition order will not be published.

Defendant Ruben V Garcia in court with Attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood.  Defendant Ruben V Garcia in custody.  
Antoni Joseph Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

At the hour of 10:09 a.m. the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of:

As to Question 1:  At the time the crime was committed, did the defendant have a mental disease or defect?

Answer: YES

As to Question 2:  As a result of the mental disease or defect, did the defendant lack substantial capacity either to appreciate the wrongfulness of the conduct or to conform that conduct to the requirements of the law?

Answer: NO

which was then read.  Clerk polled the jury and the Court discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion to set aside the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.  The Court orders the defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

The Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession, Body armor possession, Ammunition possession, and Voting.  
The Court advised the defendant that a dna sample and surcharge to be ordered upon sentencing.  Filed,  Verdict Form.

****BRANCH 25 TO RETAIN THIS MATTER POST 2-1-16 ROTATION FOR SENTENCING****  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 1, 2016 at 08:30 am. BEFORE JUDGE ROTHSTEIN, BRANCH 25 in Room 404 of the Courthouse.

Defendant Ruben V Garcia not in court, defendant in custody.
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for continuation of Jury Trial.  All jurors present.  Deliberations resumed at 9:05 a.m. Court in recess pending verdict.

Defendant Ruben V Garcia in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood.  Defendant Ruben V Garcia in custody.  Antoni Joseph Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Trial continued. Jury in the box: 1:11 p.m. Sworn for the State: Dr. Deborah Collins. Exhibits 4 & 5 received. Jury out of the box: 1:45 p.m. Jury in the box. Continued testimony of Dr. Collins. State rests. Defense has not additional witnesses. Testimony closed. Jury out of the box: 2:56 p.m. Sidebar placed on the record. Jury in the box: 3:43 p.m. Court instructed jury. Closing arguments by State and defense. Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 4:38 p.m. to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Terrell & Sullivan who were duly sworn for that purpose. Jury released for the day and ordered to return at 9:00 a.m. on 1/28/16 to begin deliberations. Case adjourned to Branch 25.

Defendant Ruben V Garcia in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood.  Defendant Ruben V Garcia in custody.  Antoni Joseph Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Trial continued. Jury in the box: 8:42 a.m. Sworn for the defense: Dr. Diane Mosnik. Defense counsel read stipulation marked as Exhibit 1 to the jury. Exhibits 1-3 received. Jury out of the box: 9:25 a.m. Court held colloquy with the defendant. Court finds the defendant freely, voluntarily and knowingly waived his right to testify. Defense counsel has no additional witnesses. State's motion for directed verdict at the close of the defense's case argued and denied by the court. Jury in the box: 9:48 a.m. Defense rests. Swron for the State: Dr. Deborah Collins. Jury out of the box: 10:52 a.m. Jury in the box: 11:47 a.m. Continued testimony of Dr. Collins. Court instructed jury. Jury out of the box: 11:57 a.m. Case passed to 1:00 p.m. for continuation of jury trial in Branch 25.

Defendant Ruben V Garcia in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood.  Defendant Ruben V Garcia in custody.  Antoni Joseph Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Trial continued. Jury in the box: 1:21 p.m. Court instructed jury. Opening statements by state and defense. Jury out of the box: 2:11 p.m. Sidebar placed on the record. Jury in the box: 2:31 p.m. Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the defense: Dr. Diane Mosnik. Jury out of the box: 3:42 p.m. Jury in the box. Continued testimony of Dr. Mosnik. Court instructed jury. Jury out of the box: 4:56 p.m. Sidebars placed on the record. Case adjourned to 1/27/16 at 8:30 a.m. for continuation of jury trial in Branch 25.

Defendant Ruben V Garcia in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood.  Defendant Ruben V Garcia in custody.  Antoni Joseph Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Jury selection continued. Additional panel of 10 jurors in court: 9:46 a.m.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  9:46 a.m. Jury panel out of the box: 10:33 a.m. Discussion regarding strikes for cause. All forty jurors present in court: 10:43 a.m. Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled and sworn.  Jury list received and filed. Court instructed jury.  Jury out of the box: 11:16 a.m. Case adjourned to 1:00 p.m. for continuation of trial in Branch 25.

Defendant Ruben V Garcia in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood.  Defendant Ruben V Garcia in custody.  Antoni Joseph Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for jury trial. Parties are prepared to proceed. Discussion regarding jury instructions. Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  1:55 p.m. Jury out of the box: 2:47 p.m. Jury in the box: 3:15 p.m. Continued voir dire. Jury out of the box: 4:07 p.m. Discussion regarding strikes for cause. Parties do not have enough jurors to proceed due to the strikes for cause granted by the Court. Jury in the box: 4:35 p.m. Court instructed jury. Jury out of the box: 4:43 p.m. Court ordered an additional 10 jurors to report to jury management at 9:00 a.m. on 1/26/16. The panel presently in court is to return to court at 10:00 a.m. Case adjourned to 1/26/16 at 9:00 a.m. for continued jury selection in Branch 25.

Defendant Ruben V Garcia in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood.  Defendant Ruben V Garcia in custody.  Antoni Joseph Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for PHASE II jury trial. Parties are prepared to proceed. In chambers discussion placed on the record. Discussion regarding jury instructions. Parties have reached a stipulation as to the facts that support the plea previously entered on 9/21/15. Court held colloquy with the defendant regarding the stipulation. Court will accept the stipulation and mark it as exhibit 1. Case passed to 1:00 p.m. for jury selection in Branch 25.

Defendant Ruben V Garcia in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood.  Defendant Ruben V Garcia in custody.  Antoni Joseph Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for final pretrial. Parties are continuing to create a proposed stipulation of facts for the Phase II trial. Defense counsel has turned over the expert report to the State. Discussion regarding the expert witnesses that will be called during the trial. Court made rulings on motions in limine. Case remains scheduled for jury trial on 1/25/16. Case adjourned to Branch 25.

Attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood in court, defendant Ruben V Garcia not in court, in custody.  Antoni Joseph Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for sentencing hearing. Branch 25 is at a judicial conference and unable to hear this matter today. Defense advised the court the defendant wishes to have a jury trial for Phase II. Parties to confer and prepare a list of agreed upon facts for the Phase II trial. Case remains scheduled for trial on 1/25/16. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

As to COUNTS 3 & 4-
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNTS 3 & 4 dismissed but read in for purposes of sentencing.

Defendant Ruben V Garcia in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood.  Defendant Ruben V Garcia in custody.  Antoni J. Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea hearing. Parties are prepared to proceed. State placed negotiations on the record. On motion of the State, Court struck the Use of a Dangerous Weapon modifier from COUNTS 1 & 2. Plea hearing proceeded.
Defendant sworn in.

PHASE I:
As to COUNTS 1 & 2 as AMENDED-  
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgments of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court advised defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing and pay a DNA surcharge.

Court ordered the defendant REMANDED into custody. 
Discussion regarding scheduling of PHASE II in this matter. Court ordered final pretrial and jury trial dates be set. 
Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Ruben V Garcia in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood.  Defendant Ruben V Garcia in custody.  Antoni J. Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for further proceedings. In chambers discussion placed on the record. State continues its objection to an adjournment of the jury trial date in this matter. Discussion regarding scheduling of Phase 1 and Phase 2 of the trial. Defense counsel advised the Court the defendant may enter a plea as to Phase 1. Court converted the jury trial date of 9/21/15 to a projected plea date. On the next court date, defense counsel to bring to court the availability of the witnesses he intends to call to testify during Phase 2. Defense counsel to advise the court on the next date if Phase 2 will be a jury trial or a court trial. Upon inquiry of the Court, the defendant advised the Court he wishes for attorney Lockwood to remain counsel of record. Parties to prepare a set of stipulated facts as to Phase 1 if Phase 2 will be a jury trial. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ruben V Garcia in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood.  Defendant Ruben V Garcia in custody.  Antoni J. Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for final pretrial. Defense counsel filed a motion to adjourn the trial date currently set. State objects. Arguments heard as to adjournment request. Court DENIED defense motion for reasons stated on the record. Discussion regarding the notice requirement for competing reports. State WAIVED five (5) days of the notice requirement for defense counsel to turnover competing reports. Defense counsel to turnover any reports 10 days before the trial date. Defense counsel stated to the Court he will not be prepared for trial by the date currently set. Court ordered this matter set over to tomorrow morning at which time defense counsel must submit a written letter to the Court indicating why he will not be prepared. Case remains scheduled for jury trial on 9/21/15. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Hearing scheduled for August 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
